content: santa and mrs by debra alling santa and mrs are very easy and fun to knit they make great toys or christmas decorations finished size is approximately 8 inch gauge is not important knitted flat with straight needles the models were done with size 5 or 3 75 mm needles using worsted yarn the skill level is basic knowledge of knitting yarn small amounts of red black white and ivory or skin colour in worsted or aran small amounts of white fun fur in bulky small piece of yellow or gold yarn for santa and pink yarn for mrs you can make the finished size smaller by using small needles and/or yarn stuffing is needed make sure all your work is secure if making for a small child abbreviations k = knit p = purl st s = stitches decrease = decrease by working 2 stitches together increase = increase by working twice in the same stitch st-st = stocking stitch k2tog = knit two stitches together p2tog = purl two stitches together b & t = break off yarn leaving a long tail thread the tail thought the stitches a pull up tightly and secure page 1 finished santa body before stuffing santa *shoes cast on 35 stitches in black row 1-4 st-st starting with knit cut yarn leaving a tail of 8 inches pants row 5-18 st-st in red do not cut red belt & cuffs cut 3 black pieces and 2 white pieces of yarn each approximately 20 inches long use a different piece for each section row 19 k5 in black k8 in white k9 in black k8 in white k5 in black row 20 p5 in black p8 in white p9 in black p8 in white p5 in black on wrong side tie ends together of each black and white section shirt row 21-30 st-st in red row 31 purl in red cut yarn leaving a tail of 8 inches head row 32-42 st-st in ivory or skin colour starting with purl row 43 k5 k2tog to end of row row 44 p row 45 k4 k2tog to end of row row 46 p page 2 row 47 k3 k2tog to end of row row 48 p row 49 k2 k2tog to end of row row 50 p2tog 7 times p1 b & t leaving a 12 inch tail ** finishing the body for santa with wrong side showing - sew a running stitch across cast on stitches for shoes using black yarn pull up tight and fasten sew leg seams together and stop at belt sew head seams together stop at first red row of the shirt this leaves an opening in the center of the back for stuffing turn right side out stuff body the head should be stuffed firmly body should be stuffed loosely sew a running stitch using matching yarn across the first row of the head and draw up forming a neck fasten_off sew the opening in the back define
